_header: Sith that God this world wrought
_description: The Siege [or Battle] of Troy — in couplets

BLEge2862.First Lines: [s]ithe þat god þi world wrouȝtheuen and erthe made of nouȝt…
BLEge2862.Last Lines: …Now lordingis saunz faileOf Troye þis is þe truthe bataile
BLEge2862.Attributed Title: The batell of Troye (running titles split across openings throughout); Explicit bellum de Troye (f. 134).
BLEge2862.Editions:
Barnicle,  Mary Elizabeth,
                        ed.  
             The Seege or Batayle of Troye.
         EETS o.s. 172 (1927); repr. 1971.

BLHar525.First Lines: SIthyn that god this worlde wroughtHeven and erthe all of nought…
BLHar525.Last Lines: …And that it may so beSeyth all amen for charite

CollArmsAr22.First Lines:
Syth god tyhys worle had wroȝtHeuen & Erþe al
                    þyng of noȝtFfele aventures hauet be falleWe þat now
                    leuyn con noȝt telleAnd þerfor wyl þat y alyue dwelleOf
                    þe batayle of troy wol y telleBut y ne may ham telle owteThay
                    were so ffale & so stowte…
CollArmsAr22.Last Lines:
With gamen & wyt grete solemnytethay ferden mery & so mot
                    weAmen amen pur charyte
CollArmsAr22.Note:
Black (1829)
XBlack,  William Henry. 
             Catalogue of the Arundel Manuscripts in the Library of the College of
                Arms.
         Unpublished, 1829, p. 31 notes that in comparison with usual
                    Siege of Troy MSS this one does not divide into ten ‘battayles’ and
                    that only the 1st, 3rd, 6th, 7th and 8th of that longer work are described in
                    this shorter one. Here it serves as a verse introduction to a prose English
                    translation of Geoffrey of Monmouth.

LincInnH150.First Lines:
[S]ythen god hade þis world wrouȝtheouene and eorþe
                    and al of nouȝtMony auturis han by falleÞat we no knowen
                    heom nouȝt alle…
LincInnH150.Last Lines:
…Such a batail as hit was oonNeuer buþ no neuer schal beo
                    noon
LincInnH150.Note:
1988 lines. Guide letter for unexecuted initial
                    ‘S’.
LincInnH150.Attributed Title:
þe batayle of troye (f. 108v); Bellum Troianum
                    (added by later hand, f. 90v)
